Consider the curve y2 = 4 + x and chord AB joining the points A(−4, 0) and B(0, 2) on the curve.

(a) Find the x- and y-coordinates of the point on the curve where the tangent line is parallel to chord AB.

frqParts.text:
Consider the curve y2 = 4 + x and chord AB joining the points A(−4, 0) and B(0, 2) on the curve.

(a) Find the x- and y-coordinates of the point on the curve where the tangent line is parallel to chord AB.
(b) Find the area of the region R enclosed by the curve and the chord AB.
(c) Find the volume of the solid generated when the region R, defined in part (b), is revolved about the x-axis.
